publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-321 Jackie Baillie: Indian Duty on Whisky Scotched—That the Parliament welcomes the move by the Indian Government to abolish the additional duty currently levied on Scotch whisky imports; recognises that this will allow Scottish distillers to compete fairly with their Indian counterparts for the first time; commends the Scotch Whisky Association for its campaign to reform the system, and welcomes the opportunity to provide consumers in India with a greater choice of internationally renowned Scotch whisky brands. Supported by: David McLetchie*, Alex Neil*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Liam McArthur*, John Park*, Pauline McNeill*, Robert Brown*, Jackson Carlaw*, Alasdair Allan*, Stefan Tymkewycz*, Mike Pringle*, Sarah Boyack*
S3M-321 Indian Duty on Whisky Scotched (lodged on 26 July 2007) Iain Gray*, Margaret Mitchell*, Karen Gillon*, Andy Kerr*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-321 Indian Duty on Whisky Scotched (lodged on 26 July 2007) Cathie Craigie*, Jack McConnell*, Bill Butler*
S3M-321 Indian Duty on Whisky Scotched (lodged on 26 July 2007) Gil Paterson*, Cathy Peattie*
S3M-321 Indian Duty on Whisky Scotched (lodged on 26 July 2007) Bill Wilson*
